de.iabg.mesh
Class NodeMatrix

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.math.AbstractMatrix
      de.iabg.math.RectangularMatrix
          de.iabg.mesh.NodeMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix
public class NodeMatrix
extends RectangularMatrix

This Matrix is designed to store the nodal coordinates of a given geometry. This matrix has several convenience methods that wrap methods from RectangularMatrix. The nodes are stored as rows and the x, y, z coordinates are stored as fixed columns. This matrix also has the ability to correlate and connect itself with another NodeMatrix. A correlation compares all nodes of this matrix with all nodes of another matrix, while a connection specifies a mapping between nodes from this matrix and another matrix. A connection can also be defined between different nodes of the same matrix, such as edges, triangle connections and quadrilateral connections. The point cloud that this matrix represents can also be rendered in Java3D by calling getScene2D(double, javax.vecmath.Color3f) or getScene3D(double, javax.vecmath.Color3f).

Version:
September 10, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Constructor Detail

NodeMatrix

public NodeMatrix()
Constructs a default NodeMatrix with no nodes.

NodeMatrix

public NodeMatrix(int nNodes)
Constructs a NodeMatrix containing the given number of nodes. It also sets the default node color to white.

Parameters:
nNodes - the number of nodes in this matrix

NodeMatrix

public NodeMatrix(NodeMatrix nodes)
Constructs a copy of the given NodeMatrix.

Parameters:
nodes - the NodeMatrix to be copied
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Removes the data from this matrix. This method wraps setNodeCount(int) and sets the number of nodes to zero. This method overrides the existing implementation so that the number of columns (coordinates) remains constant.

Specified by:
clear in interface Matrix
Overrides:
clear in class RectangularMatrix

computeDistanceCorrelation

public NodeCorrelationMatrix computeDistanceCorrelation(NodeMatrix nodes)
Computes a matrix of the distances between each node in this NodeMatrix and the given NodeMatrix. The nodes of this matrix are the rows of the returned NodeCorrelationMatrix, while the nodes of the given matrix are the columns.

Parameters:
nodes - the NodeMatrix that will be correlated to this NodeMatrix
Returns:
the matrix of the distance correlation

containsAll

public boolean containsAll(KeyList nodeKeys)
Returns true if this matrix contains all of the node names specified in the given subset.

Parameters:
nodeKeys - the node names to be checked
Returns:
true if this matrix contains all of the nodes names; false otherwise

getBoundingRadius2D

public double getBoundingRadius2D()
Returns the 2D distance of the furthest node from the origin. The 2D distance is calculated from only the x and y coordinates.

Returns:
the 2D distance of the furthest node

getBoundingRadius3D

public double getBoundingRadius3D()
Returns the 3D distance of the furthest node from the origin.

Returns:
the 3D distance of the furthest node

getNodeCount

public int getNodeCount()
A convenience method which wraps AbstractMatrix.getRowCount().

Returns:
the number of nodes

getNodeNames

public java.lang.String[] getNodeNames()
A convenience method which wraps AbstractMatrix.getRowNames().

Returns:

getReducedDistanceCorrelation

public NodeCorrelationMatrix getReducedDistanceCorrelation(NodeMatrix nodes,
                                                           KeyList firstNodeKeys,
                                                           KeyList lastNodeKeys)
Makes a copy of this NodeMatrix and the given one, sorts each by the corresponding given node names, and computes the resulting NodeCorrelationMatrix.

Parameters:
nodes - the NodeMatrix that will be correlated to this NodeMatrix
firstNodeKeys - the new order of the nodes of this matrix
lastNodeKeys - the new order of the nodes of the given matrix
Returns:
the matrix of the distance correlation

getScene2D

public javax.media.j3d.BranchGroup getScene2D(double scale,
                                              javax.vecmath.Color3f backgroundColor)
This method has not been implemented.

Parameters:
scale - the scale of the scene
backgroundColor - the background color of the scene
Returns:
a new branch group

getScene3D

public javax.media.j3d.BranchGroup getScene3D(double scale,
                                              javax.vecmath.Color3f backgroundColor)
Creates a Java3D scene of the point cloud that this NodeMatrix represents at the given scale and with the given background color. If there are no nodes present, only the background is created. The nodes are rendered with the current node color and can be changed beforehand by calling setNodeColor(javax.vecmath.Color3f).

Parameters:
scale - the scale of the scene
backgroundColor - the background color of the scene
Returns:
a branch group containing the background and point cloud that this matrix represents

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tests to see if this NodeMatrix has no data. This method overrides the previous implementation by only checking that the are no nodes.

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface Matrix
Overrides:
isEmpty in class AbstractMatrix
Returns:
true if this matrix has no data; false otherwise

setColumnCount

public void setColumnCount(int nColumns)
This method does nothing and overrides the previous implementation because the number of columns (coordinates) should not change.

Specified by:
